    • Constructor Detail

      • CreateClient

        public CreateClient()
        Starts the CreateClient by running the Robot GUI with the APPLICATION_NAME (Currently "My First Robot Program").

      • CreateClient

        public CreateClient(java.lang.String applicationName)
        Starts the CreateClient by running a GUI titled by the String applicationName.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - String text which sets the title of the Robot GUI

      • CreateClient

        public CreateClient(java.lang.String applicationName,
            java.lang.String peerHostname)

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the Create by sending the start command over the serial cable from the Qwerk to the Create. Also reads sensor data from the Create to determine the initial configuration of the robot

      • playSound

        public void playSound()

      • moveMotors

        public void moveMotors(int leftMotor,
              int rightMotor)
        Sets the velocities of the Create's left and right motors in millimeters per second.
        Overrides:
        moveMotors in class RobotClient
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - Velocity of Create's left wheel in millimeters per second
        rightMotor - Velocity of Create's right wheel in millimeters per second

      • moveMotors

        public void moveMotors(int leftMotor,
              int rightMotor,
              int runningTime)
        Sets the velocities of the Create's left and right motors in millimeters per second, and runs the motors for a set amount of time determined by runningTime. After the time has elapsed the motors are stopped.
        Overrides:
        moveMotors in class RobotClient
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - Velocity of Create's left wheel in millimeters per second
        rightMotor - Velocity of Create's right wheel in millimeters per second
        runningTime - Time in milliseconds for the motors to run

      • stopMoving

        public void stopMoving()
        Stop the Create's motors by sending 0 mm/s velocities

      • setPlayLED

        public void setPlayLED(boolean state)
        Set the state of the LED located next to the play ('>') button
        Parameters:
        state - State to set the LED to - true is on, false is off

      • setAdvanceLED

        public void setAdvanceLED(boolean state)
        Set the state of the LED located next to the advance ('>>|') button
        Parameters:
        state - State to set the LED to - true is on, false is off

      • setPowerLED

        public void setPowerLED(int color,
               int intensity)
        Set the power LED's color and intensity
        Parameters:
        color - Set the color of the LED - 0 = green, 255 = red, and values between mix green and red
        intensity - Set the intensity of the LED, valid values range from 0 (off) to 255 (completely on)

      • setAllLEDs

        public void setAllLEDs(boolean play,
              boolean advance,
              int color,
              int intensity)
        Set the states of the play, advanced, and power LEDs with a single method
        Parameters:
        play - State to set the LED located next to the play button ('>') to - true is on, false is off
        advance - State to set the LED located next to the advance button ('>>|') to - true is on, false is off
        color - Set the color of the power LED - 0 = green, 255 = red, and values between mix green and red
        intensity - Set the intensity of the power LED, valid values range from 0 (off) to 255 (completely on)

      • closeRobot

        public void closeRobot()
        Closes the serial connection between the Qwerk and the Create. This should be done at the end of a program.

      • dockRobot

        public void dockRobot()
        Sends the dock command to the Create, causing the Create to seek out a charging dock and charge itself.

      • unDockRobot

        public void unDockRobot()
        Simple method for moving the Create robot off of a charging dock. This method just backs the Create robot up 40 cm and then turns the robot 180 degrees.

      • moveDistance

        public void moveDistance(int travelDistance)
        Causes the Create to move in a straight line by the number of millimeters specified by travelDistance.
        Parameters:
        travelDistance - Specifies distance for create to move in millimeters. Negative values are backwards.

      • moveAngle

        public void moveAngle(int travelAngle)
        Cause the Create to rotate by the number of degrees specified by travelAngle
        Parameters:
        travelAngle - Specifies the number of degrees to rotate - positive values cause counter clockwise rotation, negative values cause clockwise rotation

      • updateSensors

        public void updateSensors()
        Updates all sensor values from the Create. All methods which access Create sensor data call this method before returning the data.

      • bumpLeft

        public boolean bumpLeft()
        Returns:
        True if the left bumper is depressed, false otherwise

      • bumpRight

        public boolean bumpRight()
        Returns:
        True if the right bumper is depressed, false otherwise

      • wheelDropLeft

        public boolean wheelDropLeft()
        Returns:
        True if the left wheel is dropped, false otherwise

      • wheelDropRight

        public boolean wheelDropRight()
        Returns:
        True if the right wheel is dropped, false otherwise

      • wheelDropCaster

        public boolean wheelDropCaster()
        Returns:
        True if the caster is dropped, false otherwise

      • cliffLeft

        public boolean cliffLeft()
        Returns:
        True if the left cliff sensor sees a cliff, false otherwise

      • cliffFrontLeft

        public boolean cliffFrontLeft()
        Returns:
        True if the front left cliff sensor sees a cliff, false otherwise

      • cliffRight

        public boolean cliffRight()
        Returns:
        True if the right cliff sensor sees a cliff, false otherwise

      • cliffFrontRight

        public boolean cliffFrontRight()
        Returns:
        True if the front right cliff sensor sees a cliff, false otherwise

      • wallSeen

        public boolean wallSeen()
        Returns:
        True if a wall is seen on the right side of the robot, false otherwise

      • virtualWallSeen

        public boolean virtualWallSeen()
        Returns:
        True if an iRobot virtual wall is seen by the central IR sensor, false otherwise

      • playButtonPressed

        public boolean playButtonPressed()
        Returns:
        True if the play button on the Create is pressed, false otherwise

      • advanceButtonPressed

        public boolean advanceButtonPressed()
        Returns:
        True if the advance button on the Create is pressed, false otherwise

      • distance

        public int distance()
        Returns:
        The distance in millimeters that the Create has traveled

      • angle

        public int angle()
        Returns:
        The angle in degrees that the Create has traveled

      • leftWheelDistance

        public double leftWheelDistance()
        Returns:
        The distance in millimeters the left wheel of the Create has traveled

      • rightWheelDistance

        public double rightWheelDistance()
        Returns:
        The distance in millimeters the right wheel of the Create has traveled

      • robotVoltage

        public int robotVoltage()
        Returns:
        The voltage of the Create's battery pack in millivolts

      • robotCurrent

        public int robotCurrent()
        Returns:
        The current draw on the Create's battery pack in milliAmps - negative numbers imply current flowing out of the battery

      • robotChargeRemaining

        public int robotChargeRemaining()
        Returns:
        The charge remaining in the battery pack in milliAmp-hours.
